Articles.Content:
Looks very nice. Pretty much exactly what Structural Disks was made for. 

Edit: I looked at the part modules documentation but I am a bit confused. Is there a module that would allow you to make a part good at shielding radiation without lots of mass? 

Edited December 3, 2016 by Benji13
this mod is a great idea, will be it continued and will be implemented the features described in the readme in github??

On 7-1-2017 at 10:59 PM, Kombat engineer said:

Only if NKD has support.

NKD?

I keep meaning to re-visit this and see if I can config it in (or more likely find a way of butchering some code) for the Orion.  Because those pesky controlled fission reactions have nothing on genuine unchecked chain reactions.
It doesn't currently work in 1.2, mind you. I am trying to finish off some of my other mods so I have time to come back to this, hopefully around 1.3.

2 hours ago, Nertea said:

It doesn't currently work in 1.2, mind you. I am trying to finish off some of my other mods so I have time to come back to this, hopefully around 1.3.

Having recently got some stuff to work that hasn't since 0.8, I don't think I'm in a position to criticise any delays. And I needed help for that too. 

Seriously, take your time, no-one's got deadlines for mods
Well I can't wait until it is released so I can integrate with it.

On 3/29/2017 at 6:50 PM, Nertea said:

It doesn't currently work in 1.2, mind you. I am trying to finish off some of my other mods so I have time to come back to this, hopefully around 1.3.

Hate to revive this thread @Nertea but I wanted to ask if this was still the plan. There still isn't a dedicated mod for simulating radiation in KSP and I honestly think this is one of the few remaining pillars of spaceflight that KSP mods do not model yet to any significant degree.

Edited September 15, 2017 by ThatOneBritishGuy...

5 hours ago, ThatOneBritishGuy... said:

Hate to revive this thread @Nertea but I wanted to ask if this was still the plan. There still isn't a dedicated mod for simulating radiation in KSP and I honestly think this is one of the few remaining pillars of spaceflight that KSP mods do not model yet to any significant degree.

I have no time to work on any projects at the moment.

6 hours ago, ThatOneBritishGuy... said:

Hate to revive this thread @Nertea but I wanted to ask if this was still the plan. There still isn't a dedicated mod for simulating radiation in KSP and I honestly think this is one of the few remaining pillars of spaceflight that KSP mods do not model yet to any significant degree.

That`s not correct. Kerbalism has radiation with magnetosphere, solar storms...

1 hour ago, Cheesecake said:

That`s not correct. Kerbalism has radiation with magnetosphere, solar storms...

Is really not the same thing. Kerbalism does environmental radiation. No other mod has yet done radiation from the craft.

Hey Nert, been poking around in some cfg stuff and stumbled across this "Mods\Kerbal_Atomics-0.4.10\GameData\KerbalAtomics\Patches\KerbalAtomicsRadioactivity" before a search that led me to this lovely older idea and thread.  Buddy I know you have been busy working on other projects but I think this guy has a strong point here.

On 9/14/2017 at 5:19 PM, ThatOneBritishGuy... said:

Hate to revive this thread @Nertea but I wanted to ask if this was still the plan. There still isn't a dedicated mod for simulating radiation in KSP and I honestly think this is one of the few remaining pillars of spaceflight that KSP mods do not model yet to any significant degree.

Now I am going to assume this isn't a simple task and would take tons of additions and alterations to a Sh!t ton of subsystems, but its an Awesome idea for the guys/girls that love the survivability builds. I understand if this isn't something you plan on pursuing now, or maybe ever, but I cant find anymore posts explaining your plan with it.  

Thx Nertea, without your Mods I probably wouldn't keep returning to KSP.
